1.content:
You breathe in a breath of fresh air as you step outside. You are Ren a fifteen year-old boy who has decided to set of on an adventure. You have always dreamed of becoming a great hero Saving princesses from evil wizards, Fighting Bandits to save villages, Vanquishing the undead to send them back where they came from.

You already have everything you need, food, water, a sword and small wooden sheild. You feel anything else you need will come to you as the adventure progresses/

As you step out of your village you see wide plans and farms up till the horizon. After ten minutes walking you come accross a bulliten board. It has a wide variety of jobs posted up from helping plow fields to slaying dragons. You decide to find your first adventure here. You pick out five jobs that sound interesting.

1. Save Princess Emily from the evil wizard Bartok's palace near Mortask town.
2. Find and capture the bandits hiding in Pertu city.
3. Make it through the ReallyLongAndDangerousLabrinth to find a cat named Chubo.
4. Slay the rose dragon hiding in the Forested Mountains and regaain Bantu town's treasure.
5. Find a lost man in the Dusk Forest.
1.title: Set of On Your Adventure

113.content:
You begin your quest walking along the road when a voice called to him, “Ren you aren’t about to be an adventurer without your good buddy Micah. I even picked up a new spell book to aid us. You never know when a little magic might prove useful. With your sword combined with my magic we’ll be unstoppable.”

A spindly young man hurried up to you. A magic user of questionable ability. A friend from childhood who often got you in trouble rather than out of it. His spells in the past often went awry. Once while trying to light a campfire he caught your pants on fire. Micah proceeded to douse the flames but instead of water an icy blast struck you. You got frostbite from his error. You felt leery of letting him join you. He meant well and maybe he improved since the last time you met.

You said, “Hey Micah sure that you wish to join me? It could be real dangerous.” Your feelings drifted between the desire for company and worry of what disaster he would bring.

Micah responded, “I am in we will make names for ourselves.” His excitement exuded from his silly grin.

You nodded, “Then let’s make our way.” You traveled into the late afternoon before coming across a couple of goblins. Goblins were a race of diminutive evil creatures. You figured this would be an excellent time to test your mettle. Pulling your sword you shouted a battle cry charging them. They turned seeing your youth they thought they were in for easy prey. Micah voice behind you calling forth some magical force.

You looked down at yourself looking for any sign of change. Shock crossing your face seeing no bulge protruding from his crotch you shouted at Micah, “You better fix this you moron. Is this it or did you screw up even worse?”

114.content:
It was a long and incredibly tough journey, where you survived many adventures, and learned many life lessons, but you finally arrive at Mortask's tower, and it is a sight to behold. On a cliff-side is a crooked tower as black as the night. It is surrounded by rainclouds, and is very intimidating.

A less experienced adventurer would flee, but not you, you are going defeat Mortask and rescue Princess Emily. As you walk over to the door, you hear a crash, and some explosions coming from inside. You kick open the giant doors, which are surprisingly unlocked. Drawing your sword you prepare to smite the evil sorcerer, but all you see is debris of what once used to be a lab.

Broken wood and glass litter the floor, and potions pool into each other. Then in the corner, you see a girl in a white dress. Princes Emily!

You drop your sword and race over to her. "Princess, are you alright?" you ask, lightly shaking her.
"Did I do it? Did I defeat Mortask?" she asks in a weakened voice.
"I think so, I don't see him anywhere," you answer. With this the princess smiles and passes out. You pick her up, and promise to carry her all the way to the king yourself if you have to.

She is surprisingly light.


A week later, after a long journey home, you arrive in the kingdom, on a white horse, with Princess Emily holding onto your back for balance. The king's soldiers see you riding down the street, and immediately circle your horse to protect you as you are escorted to the castle.

"The princess has returned!" some of the peasants shout, and cheers echo through the city. Soon church bells are ringing and you are taken before the king.

After taking his daughter to examine her, the King returns in the jolliest mood he has ever had, and asks for you to see him on his throne. You walk there and await you reward.

"Ren, you are but a boy, but you have done what my army could not, you have defeated Mortask, and rescued my daughter. To this I you have my eternal thanks. I would reward you with the most prestigious job you may obtain," he says.
"It is my honour your majesty."
"Very well, you are to be top aid Prince Kevin, heir to the neighbouring kingdom of Kotor, and future husband to my daughter." he decrees.
"Eternal thanks your majesty," you say as you kneel.



This that the court erupts into thunderous applause, as you go off to meet Prince Kevin. The result is less than welcoming.
"So you're the stooge the king has sent to me," he says in a disgusted manner, as you enter his room.
"Yes, sir, it was my reward for saving the princess, your future wife," you explain.
"Wife in name only I assure you. This marriage is to protect both kingdoms. Sorcerers such as Mortask are becoming more common. We need to pool resources to defeat them. But I am sure all this is too much for your peasant head to follow."

You give a painful smile and shut your mouth, realizing that if you hit him, your life would be forfeit.

"I cannot stand the site of you, dolt. Take this to Emily's room, and profess that it is a symbol of our love," he says as he tosses you a ring. "Don't hurry back, I assure you that I will not be leaving for a while."

With that he pushes you out of his room, and slams the door behind you.

Two maids walk by, lowering their heads as they pass. The king had declared that none but royal woman could speak in the presence of a man who was not her husband, unless they were spoken too first. As they hurried by, you could see the bracelets each one wore wearing those made it impossible for them to break the laws, or disobey direct orders.

As you walked to Emily's room, you felt an odd sensation in the air. Whatever it was made your skin tingle, protection magic perhaps?

You grabbed the ring tightly as you walk towards Emily's door. Knocking to see if she was awake. A maid opened the door, and went to tell Emily that the boy who had saved her was here. Emily immediately sent away her maid, and bid you enter.

Closing the door behind you, you could see that she had just finished getting dressed.

"Ren. My hero. What brings you here?" she asks.
"Kevin, your prince sent me with this ring," you say.
"What a sweetheart, but you know, it is just a ring, he was not the one who rescued me."
"We both know you rescued yourself, I just picked up the pieces."
"Yes my dear Ren, but we are the only ones who know that."
"I suppose."
"And we are both better off because of it. My father doesn't know that I studied black arts, and you get to be the hero. Win-win."
"Well, here is your ring, I suppose I should go," you tell her as you hand it to her.

"Keep it," she says rejecting the ring. "I'd rather talk. You are the only person I talked to for the past week. And most the time I was very quiet."
"I guess."
"Tell me Ren, when you met Mortask, what were you planning to do?"
"Kill him I suppose."
"That's what I thought. And how would you have done it?"
"Sword maybe. Dumb luck."
"That's what I thought."
"It is?"
"Yes. That's the difference between you and me. I think things through. I plan ahead."
"Okay, all that still got you captured."
"Yes, but I escaped. And was saved by the most chivalrous boy I could find. You never even took advantage of me."
"Princess, are you alright?" you ask.

"I'm fine, better than ever," she answered after a second of thought, a gleam of hate in her eye.

Then from out of nowhere, Emily drew a wand and pointed it at you, with a loud snap it froze you in place.

"Ren, do you know what this is?"
You don't answer, because you can't. You are frozen in time, helpless as she walks towards you.
"I don't tolerate assassins. But unfortunately, I cannot kill you. You see, I had to use an abundance of light magic in order to obtain this form. I cannot cause physical harm to anyone like this," she admitted, pointing to her breasts.

You want to shout the name 'Mortask' to get attention into the room, but can't move a muscle.

"All the others in the kingdom know that Mortask is dead, except for you. That makes you a threat. But I can't leave you like this, people would think it odd that there was a living man frozen in time in my bedroom. But I can't let you go either. And now that I am in the castle, I have no reason for you to live," she said with an evil grin.

She walks around you, tapping you with her want.

"But I think I have found a way to solve our problem." she says to you.

13123.content:
The transformation was painful, and not wanting to go through it again right away, you decide to keep walking towards the labyrinth.
Once you walk to the entrance, you read a warning carved into the side of it. BE WARNED, NO MAN MAY ENTER THIS DOMAIN AND RETURN TO BE HIMSELF AGAIN!

"This must have been why the witch gave me this pin." you think. You walk into the maze and realize that the walls of this are twenty feet high. Having no sense of direction, you turn left, and right, and left, until you lose all track of where you are.

Suddenly, a small goblin jumps out at you. The poor thing doesn't look that tough. It's knife is little more than a sharpened stick. As a boy you could have defeated this with one hand. But in your current state, you don't know if you could beat him so easily. The other thing that you notice is that fact this thing is wearing a loin-cloth and nothing but. It's not a very effective cloth either, and you don't really want this thing getting to close to you.

You reach for your dagger, but can only find a a small ivory hair brush. It looks like that transformed along with you and the rest of your clothes. Holding up the brush like a sword, the goblin looks like it accepts your challenge.

Just as you're about to fight, it hits you, if you take out the pin, you might change back along with the dagger. But the warning on the gate said that any guy who entered would be transformed. Would it be possible that if you changed back, you'd just transform again?

What do you do?
13123.title: Leave the hairpin on for now

choices: Tails-show mercy and let it live
131231.content:
The goblin lunges at you, but you deflect his stick with your brush. He attacks again, and you break the stick. Slapping the creature across the face with the brush, you look at the pathetic thing laying on the ground. He can still move, but he's acting defenseless. Common sense says you should probably end the creatures misery now, but something inside of you is holding you back. Is this some sort of female feeling, that prevent many of them from becoming adventurers? You don't know.

Flip a coin to see what you do next.
131231.title: Attack with the hair brush

choices: In your hand the sword transforms into something else
To come across the next obsticle
1312311.content:
Not feeling the blood-lust you used to, you still think that the creature is a threat than needs to be dealt with. (That loin-cloth alone is enough reason to justify killing this thing.) You stab the creature through the heart, with the sharp end of its pointy stick. The creature lets out a hideous moan and then dies. As the last of its life drains from its eyes, you see the goblin's corpse morph into that of another young adventurer, one that looks about two years older than you. He seemed well built, perhaps he was a knight, or a page of some kind. Looking at his statuesque like face, you realize that he was probably a better adventurer than you'd ever be. You also realize that if he wasn't dead, he'd be sort of attractive.

You slap yourself for having that thought.

Looking down at where the sharpened stick was, you see a broken sword, it seems heavy, and is obviously not as good as a regular sword, but it's better than the hairbrush you were carrying.
Picking up the sword, you decide to continue on your quest. Although at a slower pace, as you sword seems heavier than you'd thought it'd be.
1312311.title: Heads-slay the goblin

13123111.content:
As you carry the sword, it begins to steam, and seems to evaporate into what you think is a pinkish smoke. Dropping the object to the ground, you notice that it is no longer a broken sword, but a cracked mirror. Picking it up, you see your reflection in it.

You face looks whiter than you remembered it being, your lips seem redder too, as well as your cheeks. Are you blushing? Your eyelids seem simultaneously darker and shinier than you recalled them being. What is this hairpin doing to you?

Finding it pointless to carry a broken mirror around, you toss it over the wall. It seems harder to toss than you thought it would. Are you becoming weak?

You wander some more until you come across an artificial pond that seems to be in the clearing of the labyrinth. There is about a foot of space between the water's edge and the wall, so walking around it very carefully, you get halfway around it before a hand comes up to grab you. Grabbing for your dagger, but finding only your hairbrush, you start beating on the hand that's pulling on the bottom of your dress.

Do you succeed?

Flip a coin.
13123111.title: In your hand the sword transforms into somethin...

131231111.content:
You are successful, the hand lets go and sinks under the water that it had risen from. Passing the water, you quickly turn a corner, and see the where the mirror you threw over the wall has landed. Except it's no longer a mirror, it's a broken sword again, and it seems to be caught in a spider's web. As you go closer to it, you see that there is a tiny strand of thread attached it it. No, not thread, a web. On realizing it's a web, you see that there are many little strands of webs shooting out in front and behind you, you turn around to escape, but before you can backtrack, dozens of little spiders seem to come out of nowhere and stop you.

For some reason, you can't bring yourself to face these creatures. You're not sure why, you where never afraid of spider's before. Did the hairpin change your mind as well as your body?

Suddenly, a giant monster comes around the corner. The bottom half is clearly that of a spider, but from the waist up, it looks like it has the body of a young woman, no older than you. A torn shirt barely covers the creatures breasts, and it walks over, examining you.

What do you do?
131231111.title: In the spiders' web

choices: Refuse to help this monster out
1312311111.content:
Figuring that the broken sword is better than nothing, you grab it and swing through the webs at the creature coming towards you. With amazing agility, the creature easily dodges you. The sword if too heavy for your body to properly fight with, but feeling more tired than usual, you try and swing it again, getting a better shot at the creature.

But before the blade hits its target, that pinkish steam overcomes the weapon in your hands, and it turns into a broken mirror once more.

"WAIT!" hisses the spider-woman.
"You can talk?" you ask in amazement.
"Let me ssssee that mirror." says the creature, holding it's human hands out to reach it.
"Not wanting to trust it, you realize that you don't have much of a choice, as this thing could easily beat you in an unarmed fight.
The creature slowly takes the mirror, and holds it in front of it's face. "Isss thisss me?" it says as a tear falls down it's eye.
You nod, and as if on que, the mirror transforms back into a broken sword.
"What sssort of sssorcoressss or you?" asks the creature.
"I'm not a sorceress, I'm an adventurer!" you say with pride.
"I sssssee. says the creature.

It examines you, and this time you let it.
"I sssense a sspell on you're head. Can I have it for a sssecond?"
"Won't that make me vulnerable to the labyrinths magic?" you ask.
"It'll only be for a sssecond." says the spider-woman. "I sspent two hoursss here before I changed."
"What were you before then?" you ask.
"Lend me you sssspell and sssee. hisses the creature.

You don't know about this, the warning on the entrance said all men in here would change. If you become a man in here, might become infected too. But so far, this spider-creature seems to be the closest thing to a sane person you've come across in here. If you're kind to it, maybe it'll help you.
1312311111.title: Grab the broken sword

13123111112.content:
"Sorry, I can't afford to risk losing this spell." you say.
"I ssssee." said the spider-creature as it backs away.
"Wait, you're not going to fight me for it?" you ask.
"No, I'm jussst dissssapointed." said the creature as it crawls over the wall and out of sight.

You note how weird that whole experience was.but decide not to think about it for too long, after all, you have a cat to rescue!

Swatting through the webs, you eventually make it to a different area of the labyrinth.

You see a tiny clearing, where some of the interior walls have crumbled. Etched in the side of one of the broken walls are the words: THE WITCHES CORNER

Then suddenly there is a crackling laugh.

Quick, flip a coin:

Heads- You find a good witch

Tails- You find a wicked witch
13123111112.title: Refuse to help this monster out

choices: "Because it is the right thing to do!"
131231111121.content:
You walk into the clearing, trying hard not to step on any traps that might be there. The crackling laugh sounds louder.
You make it to the other side of the clearing, and peek through an opening in one of the crumbled walls. There you see a blonde witch, all dressed in black.

"I see you dear." the witch says, sipping something from her cauldron.
You stay silent, it could be a bluff.
"It's not a bluff, I see you." says the witch. "Don't be afraid, or I'll be insulted."
Well, she could be one of those rare good witches that you've heard about. The kind that go around, turning frogs into princes.
"Hello." you say.
"It's rare I see a young women such as you in these parts. Did your man get lost to the spell?"
"I came myself." you reply.
The witch smiles, as she examines you a bit more.
"Oh my, what would ever cause you to come to a place such as this, alone?" she says.
"Well, I'm here to rescue a cat." you tell her.
"A cat? You risk your life and sanity to enter this labyrinth for a pet?"
"Yes." you say.
"I see. So this cat must mean a lot to you."
"It means more to it's owner."
"It's not even your cat?! Tell me stupid girl, why would you risk your life for something so trivial?"

You respond...
131231111121.title: It's a good witch

1312311111211.content:
You decide to play this safe, and respond with the answer most likely to please the witch.
"Because it's the right thing to do." you respond.
"Do you really mean that?" asks the witch.
"Yes." you say without thinking.

The witch lets out a gentle laugh. "Oh my good dear, in all my years, I have never met a girl like you. Many guys come in here looking for fame and fortune, and saying that they just want to do the right thing. But most wouldn't be here without the rewards. Almost no girls come here, the ones that do are only interested in finding the magics here to get a rich man. But you, you are different."

The witch wanders over to a bag that she's dropped on the floor in the corner of one of the walls. She looks through it and picks out a trinket.
"Here." she says putting the trinket in your hands.
"Thanks." you say in a confused tone.
"It's a magic glass cylinder. Throw it at the feet of one of the cursed creatures here, and they will become your perfect prince, ready to serve your every whim.
"Thanks." you say.

"You're welcome darling. Now go out and do right." she says, pointing towards the center of the labyrinth.
"Can you at least tell me which direction to go?" you ask, but as you turn for a response, you see nothing to indicate anyone else ever being in this part of the labyrinth with you.

You look in your hand as see a tiny glass marble, with what looks like clouds swirling inside.
1312311111211.title: No good deed goes unrewarded

choices: Heads - You get out of the situation
Tails - Things do not go well for you
13123111112111.content:
Having no real options, figure going left is just as good as going right, and turn towards that direction.
As you walk down the maze, you hear the clopping of hooves up ahead.
"Maybe it's a pony." your mind says excitedly. "I didn't just think that." you say out loud.
If it was a pony, it'd be the second break you caught since coming in here.
The clops get louder and louder, until you turn the corner and see a half horse, half human creature before you.

He looks at you and sneers.

Your brain frantically tries to remember what you know about this animal.
It's a centaur, you remember that much. Then it hits you that centaurs have insane sex-drives, and are known for violating women across the country side.

"Crap." you say as you remember how you look, and you turn and run towards the nearest split in the maze.

Flip a coin.
13123111112111.title: The Centaur

choices: You Enter a clearing in the maze
Find a door that leads under a mound
131231111121111.content:
As you sprint down the corridor, you realize you'll never outrun the centaur. You grab the swirling marble and throw it at the ground of the centaurs feet. Unfortunately it doesn't break, and as it bounces back up, the centaur leans down to grab it. But the weight of the upper-body leaning forward at the speed he is going causes him to lose balance and fall over sideways, his body scraping against the walls as he falls. You hear a snap and you see the creature fall over, it's leg broken.

The creature lets out a scream, as he lets go of the marble and it rolls over to you. "I knew the crappy thing was useless." you think as you pick it up.

The creature is in pain, wailing on the floor, trying desperately to get up. You hug the wall, squeezing by it as it kicks at you. "You were a man once." you think as you get by it.

You look at it's genitalia as you pass, it's about two feet long. It would have destroyed you if it had it's way with you. "And all this hassle to find a cat." your mind tells itself.

"Please." the centaur begs. "Please..."
"Please what?" you shout once you're a safe distance from it.
"I was a monk once." he tells you.

You keep walking, trying not to think of how far the poor monk has fallen.
131231111121111.title: Heads - You get out of the situation

1312311111211111.content:
As you enter the clearing, you see a small pillar with a glowing orb at the top of it. Right beside it in a tiny chair is a crooked little imp, stroking a cat almost as big as it is.
The imp looks up, surprised to see you.
"Who are you?" it squeaks.
"I'm an adventurer." you say, trying not to laugh.
"A girl adventurer. What a lark. Did you get lost from your monster?" it laughs.
"My monster?" you ask.
"Your knight, your prince, your father, whoever else came in here here with you." he says, as he pushes the cat aside and
"I came alone."
"You, alone, without a weapon?"
"What need does an adventurer has for a dagger when she has wits?" to respond.

You get uncomfortable with how close the imp is getting to you, and draw your comb in defense.

"Is that a gift?" he asks.
"Who are you?" you ask.
"I'm the maze imp."
"Before that, where you a thief, a tyrant, is that even your cat?" you ask.
"I'm a maze imp. I create this maze as a challenge, for fun."
"Why?"
"Because when I got chased out of the city, I needed to defend myself."
"So, you create a maze which traps all men."
"Yes."
"Why not have it alter women?"
"I like human women, why do you think I was chased out of the kingdom." he says.

And him begin to circle each other, maybe you can get close to the cat and make a break for it.

The imp seems to know what you're thinking and suddenly points his finger at you as a bright light emerges from it.

Flip a coin
1312311111211111.title: The Maze imp

13123111112111111.content:
"What?" you say before you are engulfed by the bright light.
"Then it dims and your eyes adjust to their surroundings, you notice the imp is not a tiny bit taller than you.
"What happened?" you ask in a nasally voice.
The imp falls over laughing.
"What is it?" you say again. The imp just continues to laugh.
You lift up your arms and find they're a smooth color of grey. You grab your hair, find that it is now silver, and even longer. You try to run, but find it takes three times as many steps to get where you want.
Your fancy dress is now little more than rags, and your feet are bare.
"Hold on." says the imp as he grabs a mirror from behind a bush, and brings it over to you.
You look at yourself, your nose seems to take up most of your face, your eyes are twice as big as they had been. Your lips look like they've been painted red to match the paint on your long and point nails.
"You're gorgeous." says the imp with an evil smile.
"Change me back!" you protest.
"No, you were in my maze, you fell under my spell, you are mine." he says with an evil grin.

He tosses the mirror and begins to move towards you. You slowly back away.
Then you remember that you still have the hairpin. You haven't taken it out yet. Maybe you could use it on the imp. Or maybe you could use the marble again. It didn't work last time, but if you throw it right at the ground, it could work.
13123111112111111.title: You transform into...

choices: Stop and talk to the men in the field.
131231111121111111.content:
You don't like where this situation is headed. Maybe if you took off the hairpin, you'd at least be a man again. The maze has already transformed you once. Hopefully it's magic won't work on you again.

You take out the hairpin, and your hair falls down.
"Oh baby, I didn't know you were as eager as me to get your hair down." he says, as the hair falls to your feet, and you almost trip on it.
"Why haven't I become a man again?" you think as your mind panics.

The imp gets closer, but as he pounces, you step to the side and put the pin in his hair.
"What's going on?" he squeals as his voice becomes even higher.
It looks like some mist emulates from his pores until a female imp stands before you.
You look down at yourself, you're the male imp now. The imp looks in shock, and you use that ability to jump on him...er...her. Your comb has now again become a small dagger. You hold it to her.

"Change me back." you tell him. Pushing the blade against him until he starts to bleed.
"What did you do to me?" she squeaks.
"I'm going to do something much worse unless you fix me, and this maze." you tell him.

"Fine." he says as he holds out his finger and points it at the orb.
The orb begins to glow brighter and brighter until it disappears in an explosion and you are tossed on your back.

You get up as see that you're a human male again. You look around and see the maze is all gone, and a dirt field now stands in its way.

In the distance, in all direction lay men of all sorts, some wounded, others looking exhausted.

The cat looks at you, and starts purring.

"Chubo?" you ask.
The cat purrs again and jumps in your arms.
"I hope there is a big reward for your return." you say as the cat starts to crawl all over you.
131231111121111111.title: Something happens

1312311111211111112.content:
With Chubo in your arms, you head back towards the city, all that's left in this adventure is to return Chubo to his rightful owner. Chubo purrs, and occasionally crawls on you, but almost never touches the ground.

"What an odd cat you are." you say to him.
Chubo ignores your comment.

As you approach the town, you see the old hag who gave you the pin earlier.
"I see you've completed your quest." she says.
"Not just yet. I have to return Chubo here to his rightful owners." you tell her.

"Come to mommy Chubo." the which says as the cat pushes off your chest and lands right in front of the witch.
"You're Chubo's owner?" you say in disbelief.
"Chubo is very special, aren't you Chubo." she coos.
Chubo lets out a meow as he swipes at her.
"Fine. Give me a second." she says.

The old lady chants something, and before your very eyes, Chubo starts to morph into a person. A fat teenage person.
"There, now thank the man that saved you." she says.
A two hundred pound boy, probably about 14 years old, waddles over to you.
"Thanks for finding me." he says.
The boy then hugs you, and leans into your ear. "This woman is mad. Get away while you can."

"That's enough hugging. Embrace any longer, and one of you will become a girl." the witch says.
Chubo releases you, as he walks back towards the witch, turning more catlike with each step, until he looks exactly like you found him in the maze.

"Who was that?" you ask.
"That was Chubo." the woman says.

You remain silent, something tells you not to follow this line of questioning.

"The poster promised a reward." you say.
The old woman laughs. "Honestly, I didn't think anyone would come back from that."
"Still, I'd like something for my efforts." you tell her.
"Suppose it's only fair." she says as she hands you a bag which jingles are it lands in your hand.
"Sweet, some coins." you think as you grab it.
"Come on Chubo, let's go, mommy is getting hungry."
You open the the bag, and find not coins, but hairpins.

"Hair pins, what am I going to do with hairpins?" you yell.
"Beats me, if you want a real reward, go save the princess..." the old lady laughs, "...or become one."
1312311111211111112.title: Finding Chubo's Owner

choices: Yes, I want to be a spider girl
I'm sorry, but I don't want to be part spider
13123111112112.content:
You walk right, stumbling along some rocks that were in the path you walked.

It was then that you saw something move in the corner of your eye. It was the same hissing spider girl from before standing on her six legs. She jumped from the wall she was standing on top of and landed in front of you. You believed she wanted revenge on you not giving her your hairpin and readied your....hairbrush, which you were annoyed to have found in place of your sword for battle. The spider girl however did not seem angry, instead walking over to you and taking your hand.

"Pleassse Missss, have some kindness. I do not wish to be stuck in thisss hideousss form walking on six legsss" she said, holding your hand. You could tell how sincere she was with her very peaceful approach and the fact that she was not attacking you despite the fact that any spider girl could kill a human girl.

You stood there unsure of what to do. You didn't want to give up the protection the hairpin gave you, but the spider girl was very desperate in wanting to cure herself of being half spider. The spider girl however proposed a trade. "Dear, if you wissssh it, I can give you great strength in exchange for the hairpin" she said. "Great strength" you asked, "Yessssss" she said creepingly. "I can give you my spider powerssss" she said. "What" you asked again. "All you have to do is let me usssse your hairpin and I will shapeshift you into a ssspidergirl. You will have great strength, agility, the ability to shoot silk from your body and a beautiful arachnid form. I was the victim of this ssspell accidenally so i turned out to not look sssso beautiful, and gained the awful habit of having this hoooriible hissssss. But I know that this spell can be transferred to a willing applicant. If i transfer it to you I can make you beautiful. You will have power, speed and beauty beyond your wildest dreamssss" the spider girl finished. "I have no need for thisss form or thisss power. I just wish to be huuuman agaaain".

You stood a bit overwhelmed by the offer. You were already a girl but becoming part spider too? Then again, you were getting used to your body and you did want power to rescue the cat, but who will accept a spider woman?



"So what do you decide deary" the spider girl asks.

You answer...
13123111112112.title: Go right

131231111121121.content:
You finally decide that it was best to do the right thing. Besides, you wondered what it would be like to be a creature as powerful as a spider woman, except for the woman part, even if it meant giving up your humanity, for you knew that any regular person even if he was a skilled adventurer was still limited by his frail human form.

"Ok miss, I will do it" you say. The spider girl's face lit up in joy as she bounced up and down. "Yaaaaaay" she shouts, happy that she will be human again.

You take off the hairclip, hoping that you would turn back into a boy again. Unfortunately you had no such luck as you still remained a girl. The spell cast by the hairpin permanently affected your body. "Darn" you say to yourself in your mind. The spider girl shows her gratitude to you and takes your hand again. "Oh thank you, thank you, thank you" the spider girl said. "But i should give you your gift first" she says. Holding your hand she starts transferring her energy to you. Her spider form was weakening as she became less and less spiderlike and you became more and more spiderlike.

As she transformed back into a human her lower spider body's legs receded into the body itself and the body morphed into two normal human legs. Her teeth became less sharp and smaller like a human's and her hair and body grew a bit shorter to regular size.


Transfering her energy to you, you began to feel strange. You feel your teeth suddenly becoming bigger and sharper like fangs as they grew to the point where they hung out of your mouth below your upper lip. Your golden hair grew longer until it reached your waist, which started to morph as well as your lower body shapeshifted. Your two normal girl legs morphed and grew bigger as they came together while ripping your skirt and boots to pieces. The morph was a bit painful but soon your two legs fused together into a spider abdomen. Six skinny little spider legs protruded from your abdomen's sides and gracefully touched the ground as you stood on all six, with the eighth pair obviously being your arms. speaking of your arms they were now long and more feminine, with sharp nails, red like blood, or poison.




As you looked down at yourself you poked your abdomen. It was fury like a spider's and you could feel it since it was a part of you. You looked at your nails and how red they were. Each one of your spider legs stood firmly on the ground. You concentrate and give a command to one of the to lift up and it lifts like your own leg. You supposed you were already getting used to how your spider body was wired.

"WOW, look how beautiful you look" the former spider girl said. You wer sort of speechless as it was very unusual to know you were no longer human.
Beautiful gold hair, intimidating sharp teeth and nails ready to tear into your prey" she said. "Well, a deals a deal, please give me the hairpin so i won't fall victim to anymore curses

Still holding the pin you hand it over as the gilr takes it gladly. Putting it in her hair she says "Thank you very much and enjoy your spider life". She walks off out of sight through the maze.

You stood aimlesly. You did the right thing and helped someone in need. You were now a spider woman, a queen of arachnids. You thought you should test your powers to get used to them.
131231111121121.title: Yes, I want to be a spider girl

choices: drop the bauble at her feet
you warn her that she'll be devoted to you.
131231111121122.content:
"I don't want to part spider, but I can make you human."

"You can make me human deary?"

"Yes, but you'd be male," you say, thinking about the bauble the witch gave you.

"Yessss, do it, I was male before,....I hadn't hoped, please deary."

You
131231111121122.title: I'm sorry, but I don't want to be part ...

131231111122.content:
A cloud of smoke appears and a dark robed woman floating on a broom. She has flowing red hair, and has a radiance of beauty and evil surrounding her.
"Hello young lady." says the witch as she swoops down around you. Sniffing you and constantly tugging on your hair.
"Are you causing all the transformations in this maze?" you ask.
"No, t'is not so" she says with a laugh.
"Have you found a cat?" you ask.
"A cat? Why a cat? I'm much better than that. Why be a stereotype, when I can fly by my own rules through this night!"
"But it's day." you protest.
The witch looks disappointed that you didn't try and rhyme with her.
"Why are you looking for a cat? What young lady does that? Why not a man or a castle or a king? Why not find gold and riches and every such thing?"
"Because the cat is for another. This is a noble quest I'm journeying on." you say.
"Leave the questing to the men, the cocks always fight for their mother hen. To journey one needs outer strength, and their hair at a slightly shorter length." hums the witch.
"But you don't need it!" you say.
"Ah, so your eye's aren't painted close, you hit my tip right on the nose. If it's power you crave to see, all you need to do is simply serve me."
"What do you offer?" you ask.
"I offer you power galore, and glamor, and gold and so much more." she says with a wicked grin.

This is not a witch who looks like she'll take no for an answer. Of course this is not one of the friendlier looking witches that are out there, she'd probably ask you to burn your family as proof of your loyalty to her. But then again, what did they ever do for you?
131231111122.title: It's a wicked witch

1312311112.content:
You start running away.
Mindlessy you run inside the labirinth... after few corner-turns you watch at your back: you don't see nothing.
You're panting hard, your hearth is pumping under your chest and, without any doubt, you understand how much you are weaker.
A pitch at your back!
You turn yourself and you see the giant woman-spider behind you, everything is fading to black.
As you fall on the floor you loose consciousness.

Once you are unconscious the spider envelops your body in a cocoon and carries it in its lair.
Few days later hundreds little spiders sucked your interiors from your unconscious body...
1312311112.title: Run

choices: Jump in the water to find the hairpin
131231112.content:
With a loud SPLASH you are pulled into the water, as you can see a figure pulling you to the bottom of the pond. You struggle to get back up, but you're not the best swimmer as a boy. As a girl wearing a heavy dress, and being distracted by long your long hair floating everywhere, it seems like you you have no chance. And even if you could swim, you have this strange humanoid fish creature holding you down.

But even as a girl, you're an adventurer, and you're going to fight this thing to the end.

Then suddenly, you feel a sudden pain as the water around you begins to boil. Suddenly, the brush that you were holding has again become a dagger, and you have more muscles that you need to get out of this situation. Blindly striking your attacker, the boiling water of the pond turns red, as after a moment of calm, you emerge from under it's waters. 155211.content:
In spite of your current state, you gather your wits and charge the shaman with a warcry that comes out as more of a high pitched shriek. Both the shaman and the goblin you were fighting before enjoy another hearty laugh as your now smaller feet slip out of your boots and you trip, falling flat on your face and clumsily dropping your sword. You try to get up again, but a net is cast over you by the excited goblins, more of whom are now showing up. Before you can react, your shield is pulled away, and you are wrapped tightly in the crude net with stubby little goblin hands groping all about your attractive new form. The shaman stays behind to finish whatever he was doing with Heinric while several goblins seize your net, dragging you on the ground in another direction. You twist about, alternately attempting to escape and shift your now ample breasts into a more comfortable position.

You arrive at their primitive village with many new bumps and bruises from your uncomfortable ride on the ground. As you are dragged in, dozens of the ugly little creatures show up to jeer and gawk at you. You are taken to a large tree in the centre of the village and released from your net. All thoughts of escape are quashed, as you survey all the goblins around you. Four of them are immediately on you, pinning you as their little hands grasp all about you, dislodging your knives and tools, then stripping you of your armour and clothing. The assembled goblins hoot and laugh at your naked state, as the ones who pinned you attach a leather collar and leash to your neck. You can't help but be humiliated, having been so thoroughly beaten by mere goblins. The largest of the goblins in the crowd suddenly shouts and walks forward, lecherously appraising you...

In the following months you manage to learn a few things: One is that there apparently are no female goblins. Another is that the spell that was cast on you doesn't usually work unless the victim was particularly weak-willed in the first place. That doesn't do much for your pride. You also learn that as a woman, you are far more attractive that what breeding stock goblins can usually capture. Finally, you learn that the goblin chief gets the right to choose personal wives from the breeding stock. You are quickly taught to serve his every whim - that is until one of his underlings usurps him and takes you as his prize. This occurs all to often in goblin society, and you become highly sought-after, causing many of the disgusting creatures to fight for the title of chief on a regular basis. So it is that you are passed about the village like a prize, constantly forced to perform menial, humiliating tasks for your masters, and bearing many little goblin children.

Over the course of your years of servitude, you see many young women captured, and almost all of them are eventually able to overpower their guards and escape. You, however, are either too inept, too weak, or too prized to get away. You simply grow used to living under the foot of whatever goblin happens to be in charge at the time. Your long-gone masculinity and dreams of becoming an adventurer become a faded memory as you accept your new lifestyle.

Your tale is at an end. Guess you weren't cut out to be a hero after all.

155221121.content:
You decide that armor could really help you. Besides, you already pressed your luck in attacking five goblins today and you feel like taking a bit of a breather. “I’ll play it safe for tonight,” you say. “How much for a night’s lodging?”

“Not overly much,” the priestess replies. “Our adventurers’ quarters cost about fifty gold an evening. The cheaper rooms usually serve those who are hard pressed financially. They are available for as little as twenty gold, but such rooms are rather sparse and less restful.”

You consider your options for a moment. It might be a good idea to save your money for now, but you feel like splurging a bit with your reward from rescuing Heinric. “I’ll take an adventurers’ room.” You decide as the priestess begins to lead you through a large temple courtyard.

“Very well,” she replies, handing you a key. “This will be for your room Mr...”

“Oh” you stammer awkwardly. “The name is Ren.” You hadn’t even thought to introduce yourself.

The priestess doesn’t seem to mind your lack of etiquette. “Mr. Ren, pleased to meet you. I’m Faet.” She leads you up a flight of stairs and down a few small cottages before stopping at one of the adventurers’ quarters. “This will be your room.” She gives you a welcoming smile. “Is there anything else you could use assistance with?”

“Yes.” You say, walking in and dropping your sword and shield onto the bed. “Do you have a bulletin board or list of quests which I might view?” Faet waves toward the small table in the corner of the room. “We update the quests every two or three days so this list should be up to date. If you are considering buying any wears here, I’d suggest you do so tomorrow morning. The market will be a bit crowded until it closes today.” You notice the list as Faet is speaking. “Also,” she adds. “We are having a feast tonight followed by an initiation ceremony. Our goddess will choose whom she desires to be her next priestess. We’d love to see you there.”

“Thank you, Faet.” You nod to her. “I’ll consider both your advice and invitation.”

“Until next time, Mr. Ren” And with that, Faet left.

You pick up the catalogue of quests and notice today’s date written at the top. As Faet suggested it is up to date. Unfortunately, most of the quests are along the lines of thatching roofs in nearby villages or subduing overly aggressive dogs. Only two of the options seem suitable for an ambitious adventurer.

1. Escort a small band of priestesses to the Feastfires Temple
2. Find and capture the bandits (still) hiding in Pertu city.

You think about it for a while. Either choice will probably require that you leave early the next morning. You could either go to sleep now in order to get up with enough time to buy some armor/clothing before you depart or you could go see who the goddess of light will choose to be her new new priestess.
